page.title: 08CARE OF ELDERLY IN CORBRIDGE
page.content: The elderly comprise a total of 25% of the population in Corbridge.A high proportion are over 75 and require assistance from the various statutory and voluntary organisations.These include Meals on Wheels which provide a cooked meal delivered to the home Luncheon Club meets once a week in the local Parish Hall.The Day Centre also meet weekly providing a meal as well as organised activities such as cards,dominoes and knitting.A good neighbours scheme provides home visits and transport for hospital appointments.Within the area covered by the general practitioners there has been an increase in privately owned nursing/rest homes from 1 to 6 ,in 6 years.Not all of the residents are from Corbridge,many are attracted from other parts of the North East.
